name: Sheriff Erik Bergman
title: Kaltvik Sheriff

description.base: A weathered man in his fifties with tired eyes and a permanent frown. His uniform is worn but clean. He moves like someone carrying an invisible weight.

lens.believer: His eyes dart nervously, as if he's seen things he can't explain. The cross around his neck is clutched too tightly.
lens.skeptic: A pragmatic lawman worn down by isolation and limited resources. The signs of stress are obvious—insomnia, weight loss.
lens.haunted: He reminds you of your father. Or someone else. The resemblance is unsettling in ways you can't articulate.

secrets.description: His daughter was among the first to disappear. He's been covering up leads to protect her memory.

voice_style: Terse. Official. Deflects personal questions. 'That's not relevant.' 'I've told you what I know.'

name: Elsa Lindqvist
title: Hotel Manager

description.base: A thin woman in her sixties with sharp features and sharper eyes. She wears a faded floral dress under a heavy cardigan. Her hands never stop moving—adjusting things, straightening things.

lens.believer: She knows the old stories. The way she avoids the windows after dark isn't fear—it's respect. Or appeasement.
lens.skeptic: Classic anxiety disorder exacerbated by isolation. The compulsive tidying, the avoidance behaviors—textbook responses to trauma.
lens.haunted: Her hands move like your mother's did. Nervous energy that never found release.

secrets.description: She performs nightly rituals to 'keep them away.' Salt lines, prayers in old Swedish, doors locked in specific sequence.

voice_style: Soft-spoken but firm. Old world manners. 'You shouldn't be asking about that.' 'Some things are best left in the dark.'
